title: Sandy Beach: Modeling rates part - c

content.description:
The tide removes sand from Sandy Point Beach at a rate modeled by the function R, given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46AC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

A pumping station adds sand to the beach at a rate modeled by the function S, given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>S</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <mn>15</mn><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40A7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

Both R(t) and S(t) have units of cubic yards per hour and t is measured in hours for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. At time t = 0, the beach contains 2500 cubic yards of sand.
content.question: Find the rate at which the total amount of sand on the beach is changing at time t = 4.

frqParts.text: Find the rate at which the total amount of sand on the beach is changing at time t = 4.

topic.text: 4.3: Rates of Change in Applied Contexts Other Than Motion

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify common underlying structures in problems involving different contextual situations.
